description: SOS project intelligence signals - grants, competitors, partnerships, market

signals.signal: Winter Storm Fern - NashvilleResponds.com launched as 'needs tracker' for Davidson County. Staffed by volunteers from Sycamore Church + Twin Lakes Telephone Cooperative. $570K+ in relief fund donations. EXACTLY SOS USE CASE.
signals.recommendation: IMMEDIATE: Contact Nashville VOAD about SOS pilot. They're doing manual needs tracking RIGHT NOW. Perfect deployment opportunity.

signals.signal: Running virtual EOC for Winter Storm Fern. Active QRFs in Tennessee (Hardin County), NYC. Partnering with Habitat for Humanity. Aviva Canada just gave them $250K. Volunteer-driven model aligns with SOS.
signals.recommendation: Reach out to Team Rubicon about tech partnership. They coordinate volunteers - SOS coordinates community needs. Complementary.

signals.signal: NEW chapter launching post-Helene. Quote: 'Dormancy is enemy of disaster resilience.' Looking to build capacity while Helene motivation is fresh.
signals.recommendation: Perfect pilot partner - new chapter building from scratch. Offer SOS as founding tech platform.

signals.signal: Q4 2025 earnings (Feb 2): Revenue guidance $7.18-7.20B for 2026 (60%+ increase). DHS + HHS using Foundry. Army contract up to $10B. Growing scrutiny over surveillance work. CEO defending tech on earnings call.
signals.recommendation: Palantir going hard on gov. SOS differentiation: community-agency bridge, not agency-to-agency surveillance. Privacy-first angle stronger than ever.

signals.signal: FEMA Review Council EXTENDED to March 25, 2026 (White House). 180+ employees signed 'Katrina Declaration' criticizing policy changes. $19B in disaster relief frozen per Dem reports. Court blocked grant changes as 'arbitrary and capricious'.
signals.recommendation: Federal funding uncertainty = states need alternatives. Position SOS as state/local resilience tool not dependent on FEMA.
signals.source: White House, Democrats.org, Smart Cities Dive Jan-Feb 2026

signals.signal: Tennessee: $9M in grants, NY: $56M approved. FEMA releasing $2.2B across 25 states. NC gets $200M+ for Helene. KY gets $114M for flooding.
signals.recommendation: States receiving FEMA money need efficient deployment tools. Target grantee states for SOS pilots.

signals.signal: 2025: US had billion-dollar disaster every 10 days. IRC: aid worker security incidents UP 33%. EU funding NIGHTINGALE project (AI + wearables for emergency care). States facing 'funding uncertainty' from federal changes.
signals.recommendation: Disaster frequency increasing = more deployment opportunities. Watch for state-level innovation as federal funding becomes uncertain.
signals.source: LAist, IRC, EU Home Affairs, Pew Jan-Feb 2026

signals.signal: Crisis Response still active: Person Finder, Public Alerts, Crisis Maps. WeatherNext 2 forecasting model launched Nov 2025. No new community coordination tools announced.
signals.recommendation: Google focuses on information/mapping, not coordination. SOS occupies different space. Watch for Google.org grants.

signals.signal: US gov revenue up 66% to $570M/quarter. Expecting $7.2B in 2026. Army contract worth $10B. Racing ahead in government space.
signals.recommendation: Focus SOS on community coordination - Palantir focuses agency-to-agency, NOT community-agency bridge.

signals.signal: 1,000+ workers being cut. Workforce went from ~29,000 to ~23,000. Creates opportunity for tech efficiency plays.
signals.recommendation: Position SOS as force multiplier for reduced FEMA workforce. Efficiency angle.

signals.signal: EDA Disaster Supplemental Grant deadline March 3, 2026. $250K-$500K available for disaster tech.
signals.recommendation: Start application this week. Due in 4 weeks.

signals.signal: Conrad Hilton Foundation - perfect mission alignment (9/10 fit). Rolling deadline. Focus on disaster resilience.
Confirmed frustration in r/EmergencyManagement and DHS OIG reports. 'Duplicative data entry' problems. Expensive, slow.
signals.recommendation: Target WebEOC customers. They're frustrated with data entry burden.

signals.signal: Emergency Management Software market $408M â†’ $964M by 2033 (11.3% CAGR). SOS TAM: $87M-$450M ARR.
signals.recommendation: Strong market tailwinds. Focus on differentiation.

signals.signal: New Mexico added $30M contingency fund for emergency management. Early adopter mindset.

activeDisasters.name: Winter Storm Fern
activeDisasters.sosOpportunity: HIGH - Nashville VOAD running manual needs tracker, perfect pilot

keyDeadlines.name: FEMA Review Council Deadline
keyDeadlines.notes: Policy changes likely after this date
